content: I have a new production Zulip server set up. I'm having trouble getting email to work (presumably because my organization's email server won't accept emails from the Zulip server). HOWEVER, that's not my only problem. When I try to do an end-around the email problem, I did so by trying to "invite more users" via the "Generate invite link". It generates a link, but when I test it (with a new user's email) the server responds with a 404 error (page not available). Did I miss something in the setup instructions?

Let me be more clear. The link that gets generated does work, in that the user is presented with a page where they can enter their email address. However, once they click the "Sign U=up" button, then they get the 404 error message.
@Ronald Chichester I'm surprised it's a 404 error, but you do need to setup outgoing email to invite new accounts even using the reusable invitation like flow.

Yeah, that's a recurring problem. I don't have an outgoing email server that will accept something from Zulip. My organization is a non-profit, and can't afford a commercial system like Mailgun. Moreover, our ISP doesn't allow us to add SPF and DKIM records, so we're stuck. Is there some way that we can use Zulip without email? Just standalone where the admin handles all the user accounts?

I agree that it should be possible to run an instance without the accounts being tied to emails. For comparison, it was much easier for me to set up a Matrix.org server because it doesn't require emails.
@Ronald Chichester isn't Mailgun free for low traffic usage?

I guess it looks like they now charge this after 3 months:

Extra emails beyond trial volume
from $0.80 / 1000 emails info

Depending on your usage, it's very possible Zulip Cloud's nonprofit discount pricing would be cheaper than self-hosting if you don't have an established way to send outgoing email; you should email sales@zulip.com with details and see.

Tim Abbott said:

Ronald Chichester isn't Mailgun free for low traffic usage?

Sendgrid (a Mailgun competitor) can send 100 mails/day for free (https://sendgrid.com/pricing/)
